territory.notes: According to the Bureau of Intelligence and Research fact sheet on Dependencies and Areas of Special Sovereignty, "Antarctica consists of the territory south of 60 degrees south latitude. This area includes claims by Argentina, Australia, Chile, France, New Zealand, Norway, and the United Kingdom, the legal status of which remains in suspense under the terms of the Antarctic Treaty of 1959. The United States recognizes no claims to Antarctica." The Antarctic Treaty entered into force in 1961, and Antarctica is administered through consultative member nations.
